title: How to Unlock a Secure PDF File

steps.title: Open Adobe Acrobat Pro.
steps.content: Open Adobe Acrobat Pro. This is the paid version of Adobe Acrobat ; if you only have the Adobe Acrobat Reader, you won't be able to unlock your PDF with this method.

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File . This option is in the top-left corner of the window (or the screen on a Mac). Clicking it prompts a drop-down menu. Alternatively, if your PDF reader has a "Recently Viewed" tab, you can check there to see if the PDF you need is displayed.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . If you elected to look for the PDF in the "Recently Viewed" section, skip this step.

steps.title: Double-click the PDF you wish to open.
steps.content: Double-click the PDF you wish to open. Doing so will prompt the PDF to open in Adobe Acrobat. You may have to select a new directory (e.g., Desktop or Documents) first to locate the PDF in question. Alternatively, you can open a PDF by double-clicking the file. If this doesn't open the file in Acrobat Pro, right-click the file and click Open with... Then click Adobe Acrobat Pro.

steps.title: Enter the user password and click Ok.
steps.content: Enter the user password and click Ok . This is necessary to view and edit the file. If you don't know the user password, you cannot unlock the PDF.

steps.title: Click the padlock icon.
steps.content: Click the padlock icon. It's on the left side of the screen beneath the "Home" tab.

steps.title: Click Permission Details.
steps.content: Click Permission Details . This is a link below the "Security Settings" heading.

steps.title: Click the Security Method box.
steps.content: Click the Security Method box. It will say something like "Password Security".

steps.title: Select No Security.
steps.content: Select No Security . This should be an option in the drop-down menu that appears.

steps.title: Enter the password again (If prompted).
steps.content: Enter the password again (If prompted). Type in the PDF's password, then click OK twice. As long as your password was correct, your PDF will no longer have a password lock on it.

steps.title: Save your PDF.
steps.content: Save your PDF. To save the PDF, click the icon that resembles a floppy disk at the top of the screen. Alternatively, you can click File followed by Save or Save as .

steps.title: Go to https://www.sodapdf.com/unlock-pdf/ in your computer's web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.sodapdf.com/unlock-pdf/ in your computer's web browser. This is the website for Soda PDF, which allows you to unlock user-locked PDF files. You cannot unlock a PDF file if you do not know the password.

steps.title: Click CHOOSE FILE.
steps.content: Click CHOOSE FILE . It's the pink button in the center of the page. Doing so prompts a File Explorer (Windows) or Finder (Mac) window to open.

steps.title: Select your PDF file.
steps.content: Select your PDF file. In the window that opens, go to the location in which your PDF is stored, then click the PDF once to select it.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. Doing so uploads your selected PDF to Soda PDF.

steps.title: Enter the user password.
steps.content: Enter the user password. In the text box which appears, type in the password used to unlock the PDF.

steps.title: Click UNLOCK.
steps.content: Click UNLOCK . This pink button is below the password text box. Soda PDF will remove the encryption from the PDF.

steps.title: Click Download File or Preview File.
steps.content: Click Download File or Preview File . To download an unsecured version of the document, click the pink button that says "Download File." To preview the file inside your web browser, click Preview File .
